alert.note: Alert for Jeff Davis (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 4:20PM CDT until May 24 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Texas, including the following county, Jeff Davis. * WHEN...Until 730 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 420 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... South Fork Cienega Creek, Barrilla Draw, Limpia Creek, Musquiz Creek, North Fork Cienega Creek, Horse Thief Canyon, Paisano Creek, Dutchman Creek, Cienega Creek, Black Creek and Horse Thief Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Davis, Camp Mitre Peak, Davis Mountains State Park and Fort Davis National Historical Site. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
